title: Creamy layer sub-classification for SC/ST reservations?
selftext:
> *“Putting the children of the parents from the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes who on account of benefit of reservation have reached a high position and ceased to be socially, economically and educationally backward and the children of parents doing manual work in the villages in the same category would defeat the constitutional mandate,”* said Justice Gavai.

More details: https://theprint.in/judiciary/should-give-way-to-deserving-needy-sc-asks-for-creamy-layer-to-be-excluded-from-sc-st-reservation/2204036/

**Thoughts?**
comments: I think it is fair, keep the benefits for people who are yet to reap the benefits of reservation.

Though I believe it is not easy to do, and maybe not for a country facing many issues like India. But a western style social security system would be beneficial if implemented rightly. It could help get rid of many issues and also issues with the freebies dispersion to everyone (As the unprivileged and backwards would already be taken care of for most of their needs.). Then again, not many systems are implemented correctly here. Just a thought.
